name: Nicole
text: DR. KYLE IS THE BEST!!! Hands down.  I was super scared, especially after hearing someone telling me that they were still in pain from having their bunion removed and 6 months later they were still in pain.  I discussed it with Dr. Kyle and he reassured me that I would be ok, because people heal differently and that he would take really good care of me.  The procedure went well, he was very happy with the results and other than some stiffness (which he tells me to just wiggle my toe and all will be well - true), I felt relatively NO PAIN.  I used the medications that were given to me and I also supplemented with some Turmeric for the swelling.  I cannot thank him enough for his professionalism, his care and his expertise in what he does.   He is a wonderful doctor and I felt lucky to have chosen him to do my surgery.  Thank you very much Dr. Kyle, you are truly wonderful, I wish I could give you more stars.

name: Joni Boulet
text:
Dr. Kyle is an extremely good doctor, very smart, but what impressed us so much was his super attentiveness to our many many questions and his reassurance to our daughter who had a pretty bad injury. Our daughter is a competitive Open Champ Irish Dancer, dancing 8 hours a week in Nashville and practicing on her own many more hours. The dance is extremely hard on the feet, and sadly, she suffered a Jones Fracture while practicing. It’s a somewhat common injury for dancers/athletes and doesn’t always heal well due to low blood flow to this particular area of the foot.

Dr. Kyle is super attentive; we never felt rushed during the appointments! He actually pulled up a video of Irish Dancing to see what stress is put on the feet, and based on the high level of stress she puts her feet through, he recommended to have a surgical screw put into the bone to ensure faster healing and to greatly decrease the chance of reinjury to this weakened area.  His nursing staff was very responsive to my many questions left on voice mail, getting back to me right away. ( yes, I was that patient’s mom, LOL) We hope never to have to see the good folks at TOC again, obviously!, but if in need, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Dr. Kyle. Oh! And he sings well. Always entered the room singing. :)

text: DR. KYLE IS THE BEST!!! Hands down.  I was super scared, especially after hearing someone telling me that they were still in pain from having their bunion removed and 6 months later they were still in pain.  I discussed it with Dr. Kyle and he reassured me that I would be ok, because people heal differently and that he would take really good care of me.  The procedure went well, he was very happy with the results and other than some stiffness (which he tells me to just wiggle my toe and all will be well - true), I felt relatively NO PAIN.  I used the medications that were given to me and I also supplemented with some Turmeric for the swelling.  I cannot thank him enough for his professionalism, his care and his expertise in what he does.   He is a wonderful doctor and I felt lucky to have chosen him to do my surgery.  Thank you very much Dr. Kyle, you are truly wonderful, I wish I could give you more stars.

name: Joni Boulet
text:
Dr. Kyle is an extremely good doctor, very smart, but what impressed us so much was his super attentiveness to our many many questions and his reassurance to our daughter who had a pretty bad injury. Our daughter is a competitive Open Champ Irish Dancer, dancing 8 hours a week in Nashville and practicing on her own many more hours. The dance is extremely hard on the feet, and sadly, she suffered a Jones Fracture while practicing. It’s a somewhat common injury for dancers/athletes and doesn’t always heal well due to low blood flow to this particular area of the foot.

Dr. Kyle is super attentive; we never felt rushed during the appointments! He actually pulled up a video of Irish Dancing to see what stress is put on the feet, and based on the high level of stress she puts her feet through, he recommended to have a surgical screw put into the bone to ensure faster healing and to greatly decrease the chance of reinjury to this weakened area.  His nursing staff was very responsive to my many questions left on voice mail, getting back to me right away. ( yes, I was that patient’s mom, LOL) We hope never to have to see the good folks at TOC again, obviously!, but if in need, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Dr. Kyle. Oh! And he sings well. Always entered the room singing. :)

name: Nicole
text: DR. KYLE IS THE BEST!!! Hands down.  I was super scared, especially after hearing someone telling me that they were still in pain from having their bunion removed and 6 months later they were still in pain.  I discussed it with Dr. Kyle and he reassured me that I would be ok, because people heal differently and that he would take really good care of me.  The procedure went well, he was very happy with the results and other than some stiffness (which he tells me to just wiggle my toe and all will be well - true), I felt relatively NO PAIN.  I used the medications that were given to me and I also supplemented with some Turmeric for the swelling.  I cannot thank him enough for his professionalism, his care and his expertise in what he does.   He is a wonderful doctor and I felt lucky to have chosen him to do my surgery.  Thank you very much Dr. Kyle, you are truly wonderful, I wish I could give you more stars.

name: Joni Boulet
text:
Dr. Kyle is an extremely good doctor, very smart, but what impressed us so much was his super attentiveness to our many many questions and his reassurance to our daughter who had a pretty bad injury. Our daughter is a competitive Open Champ Irish Dancer, dancing 8 hours a week in Nashville and practicing on her own many more hours. The dance is extremely hard on the feet, and sadly, she suffered a Jones Fracture while practicing. It’s a somewhat common injury for dancers/athletes and doesn’t always heal well due to low blood flow to this particular area of the foot.

Dr. Kyle is super attentive; we never felt rushed during the appointments! He actually pulled up a video of Irish Dancing to see what stress is put on the feet, and based on the high level of stress she puts her feet through, he recommended to have a surgical screw put into the bone to ensure faster healing and to greatly decrease the chance of reinjury to this weakened area.  His nursing staff was very responsive to my many questions left on voice mail, getting back to me right away. ( yes, I was that patient’s mom, LOL) We hope never to have to see the good folks at TOC again, obviously!, but if in need, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Dr. Kyle. Oh! And he sings well. Always entered the room singing. :)

name: Nicole
text: DR. KYLE IS THE BEST!!! Hands down.  I was super scared, especially after hearing someone telling me that they were still in pain from having their bunion removed and 6 months later they were still in pain.  I discussed it with Dr. Kyle and he reassured me that I would be ok, because people heal differently and that he would take really good care of me.  The procedure went well, he was very happy with the results and other than some stiffness (which he tells me to just wiggle my toe and all will be well - true), I felt relatively NO PAIN.  I used the medications that were given to me and I also supplemented with some Turmeric for the swelling.  I cannot thank him enough for his professionalism, his care and his expertise in what he does.   He is a wonderful doctor and I felt lucky to have chosen him to do my surgery.  Thank you very much Dr. Kyle, you are truly wonderful, I wish I could give you more stars.

name: Colleen Morgan
text: I met Dr. Kyle for the first time today. I was impressed by his immediate understanding of my concerns. He was very assuring that the condition I was most concerned about was not as serious as I had thought and was on its way to healing. He quickly assessed my secondary concern, which did need medical treatment. He was caring and performed a procedure, about which I was quite anxious. It was virtually pain free, to my surprise! Dr. Kyle is very personable and has a very caring, engaging manner. I wish I had worked with him 18 months ago, when my medical issue was first addressed by another physician at another provider.  Dr. Kyle is a good physician.

name: Joni Boulet
text:
Dr. Kyle is an extremely good doctor, very smart, but what impressed us so much was his super attentiveness to our many many questions and his reassurance to our daughter who had a pretty bad injury. Our daughter is a competitive Open Champ Irish Dancer, dancing 8 hours a week in Nashville and practicing on her own many more hours. The dance is extremely hard on the feet, and sadly, she suffered a Jones Fracture while practicing. It’s a somewhat common injury for dancers/athletes and doesn’t always heal well due to low blood flow to this particular area of the foot.

Dr. Kyle is super attentive; we never felt rushed during the appointments! He actually pulled up a video of Irish Dancing to see what stress is put on the feet, and based on the high level of stress she puts her feet through, he recommended to have a surgical screw put into the bone to ensure faster healing and to greatly decrease the chance of reinjury to this weakened area.  His nursing staff was very responsive to my many questions left on voice mail, getting back to me right away. ( yes, I was that patient’s mom, LOL) We hope never to have to see the good folks at TOC again, obviously!, but if in need, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Dr. Kyle. Oh! And he sings well. Always entered the room singing. :)

name: Meredith R.
text: Dr. Refused to wear a mask in exam room with me.  I complained but he did not care!!!

resp.text:
I’m sorry for whatever led to this dishonest review. We last saw Meredith in April 2020 when our state was under the “Stay At Home” order. At the time, masks were not required but were only recommended. While I did enter the room without a mask, Meredith rudely asked why I didn’t have one. I responded because they were not required; however, if it made her more comfortable I would be happy to wear one. There was no refusal to wear a mask. I would have happily worn one and now do everyday. She replied by saying that it was fine and she didn’t want to argue. I agreed that I wasn’t interested in arguing and only wanted to help with her inserts. After the adjustments of her device were made, I returned into the room where Meredith had apologized for her rudeness. I am shocked to have received notification of this review because she left in such a good mood. During her visit, we had safety measures in place, but masks were not one of them. In April and May, our office had anyone scheduled to notify us via phone once they had arrived. We would call them back via phone when a room was available for them to come in. As the effects of this virus increased, our office began asking everyone to wear masks during there visit. We did not make this mandatory and left the decision up to each individual. However, as of July 16, 2020 the state amended the “Safer At Home” order to require everyone to wear masks. As of now, we do not allow anyone in our office without a mask until this order has expired. Once expired our office will continue wearing masks but only recommend that our customers/patients wear one. We also began checking everyone’s temperature by using an infrared thermometer before signing in to be seen. I’m sorry that you are unhappy with how our business has attempted to operate during this unparalleled time. Hope your feet are happy!

Steven Ford, C.Ped

I went in and he watched me walk and wrote a list of suggested shoes that would better serve me and took a mold of my feet. I bought the shoes (way cheaper than air max) returned to their clinic and they put my custom orthotics in and made sure everything was adjusted properly. text:
I made an appointment with Dr. Joe Griffin and was more than please with my visit. I was able to make an appt within a weeks time. I took time off from work and when I arrived I was greeted and the wait time was minimal.

I only waited a short period of time before Dr. Griffin cane into the exam room. Because it was my 1st time at a podiatrist, I did have a lot of questions. He examined my foot and confirmed the diagnosis given by my GP as Morton’s Neuroma. He explained all of my options and even steered me away from expensive options. I was happy to be given some pads to try and was given the option To get an I injection at this visit.

I liked that he didn’t make me wait to try the pads before I was given the injection. The procedure was pain free, for me. I liked that he used a machine that appeared to be an ultrasound to make certain the medication was put in the correct location.

My husband also had a good experience with the bone spur on his heel. The boot he was recommended to get worked like a charm. He had tried all kinds of exercises and meds before he met Dr. Griffin.

I would recommend Dr. Griffin for your podiatrist.

Karen

I know that if I had failed to show up for my appointment, I would be charged a fee. My time is valuable also and I expect a discount for wasting my time

text:
I had a bunion and bone spurs removed from my left foot and it was a wonderful experience.  It’s been a week and my post op visit was great, I’ve had minimal pain (almost none at all), and was able to return to work in a few days.  My only regret is not having it done 10 years ago!

Dr. Russell  & his staff are amazing and made the whole process easy and stress free.  Highly recommend getting this done and I’m looking forward to having the same procedure on my right foot in a few months.

name: Marvin Walker
text: Dr Russel took time to explain exactly what was wrong and provided treatment options that did not involve surgery until absolutely necessary. Took time to listen to me and then explain things in a very understandable way. Highly recommend Dr Russel and the staff at Podiatry Associates.

name: Louanne Howard
text: My experience with foot surgery Dr Russell did on me was perfect. He has been so caring and I didnt feel just like a number.  He and his staff has been perfect for all my surgery and post surgery experience.  I Highly recommend him.

name: Bama Berry
text:
"FANCY FEET"
I recently received care from Dr. Russell for pain I was having in my right foot and big toe. After discovering that I had a bunion and 2 bone spurs in that foot, we discussed surgery, but not after first trying meds, a shot in the affected area and wearing a graphite insole in my shoe. 2 weeks after this, I returned for a check up and the pain was almost 100% gone. No surgery for now! Thanks, Dr. Russell, for doing a great job!
Sincerely,
Lori Moon

name: Harold Gilland
text: Dr Collier, Brooke and the entire staff are great! Dr Collier spent time with me and made sure all my questions were answered. Brooke worked with me to get the proper measurements of my foot and helped me pick out the best shoes for my diabetic feet. Thank you so much for your care and following up with me. You guys are the best!

text: Office staff sent my paperwork in the mail. I filled it out and returned to them while my husband and I traveled.. I arrived at the office early, and I only waited about 5 minutes. The receptionist had my paperwork ready, and i went on back. Nurses and assistants were friendly and gave me a smile in the halls. The young man had trouble getting my B/P since he couldn’t get the wrap to hold on my skinny arm. He was very patient as he did get a good reading. He did my x Ray also, and he was very courteous and professional. 5 stars to him also! Dr. Collier was just as kind and professional as she was 10 years ago when I last saw her. She gave my injection in my bunion, which I hope lasts 10 years from the last one. Dr. Collier’s office is very beautiful and spacious. The last time I saw her, the office was on Honeysuckle Avenue. I was out within 40 minutes to go about my day. It was an ideal doctor’s visit.

name: Connie Hoffman
text:
I have had two appointments with Diane Collier.  I have attempted to have two additional appointments, but due to the tremendous wait time, I had to leave the office w/o being seen both times.  The first time I waited for 45 minutes and there was still several people ahead of me.  Today I waited for 35 minutes and asked to speak with someone.  Another patient came over while I was speaking with the Dr and said she had been there for 2 hours and no one came out to speak with her to let her know what was happening.

She was completely aware of the back log over the last several weeks due to a new computer software system they had installed.  Rather than call patients and let them know, or perhaps schedule some distance between the patients, the scheduling was not changed.  I would NOT RECOMMEND seeing any Dr that shows this kind of lack of consideration for their patients.

resp.text:
I am sorry for your wait time today.  With the new software and coding changes, we have already been scheduling lighter than usual.  I have looked into making additional changes in the schedule, but that would crowd people who already have upcoming appointments.  I feel this will all be resolved within the next couple of weeks.  I regret this situation today was not addressed in a more timely manner by my staff.
Again, I truly am sorry that you were put out in this way.  I do understand how it is to have a job and try to get away for doctor's appointments.   I am also a patient and I personally know it is very difficult.  I hope that you will accept my sincere apology.

name: Kathi Carlson
text: Brought my 85 year old Mother to see Dr. Collier for problems with her feet.  Office is brand new and looks nice.  We had all paperwork filled out in advance, and a 4:15 appointment time; assumed it would be short wait.  My Mom was thirsty, no water fountain of any type for my Mom.  Staff would not even offer her a drink of water from a paper cup.  I was afraid to leave, fearing she would be called back and I would not be there to assist my Mom.  55 minutes later, they took us back to see the dr. in the exam room.  Dr. Collier was nice enough, but never addressed the fact she was the doctor in to see my Mom.  She cut my Mom's skin while trimming her toenails.  Her eyes were very red, indicating she was very tired from too long hours and overworking.  I think she should cut back on amount of clients, get some much needed rest, and for God's sake, get some type of water for your patients!!

resp.text: We apologize if your experience was not ideal. We strive to provide the best in patient care and satisfaction. We do however, have two water fountains by the rest rooms that are available to our patients and guests. We apologize if our staff did not point those out to you. We would have also been more than happy to bring her a cup of water. In regard to your wait time, sometimes we bring our patients back to the exam rooms and the patient procedures take a little longer than expected, which can occasionally cause our appointments to run behind. We are constantly striving to see patients in a timely manner and to stay on schedule when at all possible. Dr. Collier has had sinus issues, and that is more than likely the reason her eyes were red on the day you were in the office. Please feel free to let our staff know in person of any issues you may have currently or in the future so we can resolve them for you in person.

name: Russell Marks
text: I was schedule for a colonoscopy on Mar 4th.  I was notified that I had to report to Surgery Center for Covid 19 test prior to having the procedure.  I called the doctor's office to see if I could have it done in Prattville area as I lived North of Prattville and was told to call Jackson Surgery Center, I did and they said that would be fine.  So I got the test and a letter saying  I had a negative result.  Then next day I get a call from JSC saying what I had was not good enough.  I was asked why I didn't get tested at JSC and explained that it was more convient to have it locally.  She stated that she lived south of Montgomery and came to work every day.  This really upset me!  Long story short I had already spent a whole afternoon getting tested and by the time she called had already begun the prep and had to cancel the procedure.  They need to get better people friendly personal    to contact patients and get there act together as far as what is acceptable covid testing.  I had this procedure at the JSC (prior to Covid) and it was a great experience just glad I didn't have contact with this person back then.

resp.text:
Mr. Marks, thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. We apologize for any confusion.  We will address this issue with our staff, the response you received certainly isn't our expectation. For future reference we have Important Covid Information on our website. You can find it here to review our policies.

https://www.jscal.com/blog/covid-19-information/
If you have further issues or questions please contact our director Missy Sallas 334-293-8484

name: Jason York
text:
We were surprised by having to pay a second co-pay, one for the facility for the doctor. It was explained that this is because the doctor is not affiliated and it is an out patient surgery. However, the doctor's name is listed as part owner, not to mention the fact that we have had out patient surgeries in the past and not had separate co-pays. We will not be using this facility again, as it appears to be using any way possible to take money. We could have refused, but we already had the time scheduled off work, and it's hard to rearrange a surgery. At the very least, they could have let us know this in advance, instead of at the time of the surgery. We will be using the Baptist hospital system from now on.

Update: No, it wasn't really addressed, we were just told that we would have to pay again or reschedule. It's not about the money, it's about letting us know in advance that there are two separate co-pays, which was not done.

resp.text: Hi Jason, we apologize for any miscommunication. Our administrative team is aware of the concern and has addressed this with the patient.  If you need future assistance or have further questions about our billing policies, please contact our Administrator Mr. John Gray 334-293-8484

name: Barbara Sowell
text: Great experience! Wonderful staff. Highly recommend!

name: leo zemke
text: I am glad everyone else had such a fantastic experience at this place but they almost let my step son DIE!  He came in and was scheduled for exploratory surgery to fix SHODDY WORK DONE BY DR CHANDLER during a sinus polyp surgery and my step son began to pour blood from his Sphenopalatine Artery and the office was more worried about getting another three hundred dollar copay out of us than helping my son.  My wife had to scream for help in the office to get nurses and a doctor to get my son and help him.  We were treated shabbily during the whole ordeal.  My step son was bleeding to death and they did not even have the ability to  give him blood at this facility.  They almost killed him!  IT WAS HORRIBLE!  A HORRIBLE ORDEAL!!!!  I should post photos of all the blood.  The clinic manager was not friendly, everyone acted as if they did not know what was going on or what to do.  They had to take my son by ambulance over the the hospital and then the nightmare continued.  The ER doctor threw my son out of the hospital room that he was scheduled to be in.  It was like they tried to kill my son and then they were trying to sweep us under the carpet or out the door.  TO HIDE US AND THE HORRIBLE THINGS THEY DID AND THE WAY THEY ALMOST KILLED MY SON!!!   It was a nightmare!  They were going to give my son a blood transfusion in the ER and sweep us out the door.  MY WIFE HAD TO ENLIST THE HELP OF THE AMBULANCE DRIVERS Who could see that our son was in agony and practically DEAD AT THEIR HANDS!  The ambulance drivers GOD BLESS THEM talked the angry, crazy doctor into keeping our son and putting us in a room for the night.  This was the worst thing that has ever happened to our family.  I would not allow this clinic to operate on a PET COCKROACH if I had one!  PLEASE BEWARE!!!

resp.text: Dear Leo, we sincerely apologize for your experience with the Jackson Surgery Center.  We strive to provide the highest level of care equally to all of our patients.  We appreciate your feedback and are addressing the issues mentioned with our administrative team.  We promise to also forward your concerns to the Jackson Hospital Administration.  Our commitment to protecting patient privacy disallows us to discuss this in an open forum.  Please do not hesitate to contact our administrator John Gray at 334-293-8484

name: Whitney Boutwell
text: Very organized...very clean

resp.text: Thank you Whitney!  We appreciate your observations and are happy to provide healthcare services to you and your loved ones.  I’ll share your comments with our team. Happy Friday!

text: My husband and I have both been here for minor outpatient procedures. We could not be more impressed with this facility and can enthusiastically recommend it to anyone needing surgery. We both had excellent care while we were there. The nurse even gave me novacaine before placing an IV in my hand (totally unnecessary, but I appreciate the thoughtfulness). I had some questions about anesthesia, and they actually brought the anesthesiologist to me to answer my concerns. After care and instructions were good.

resp.text: Carol we so appreciate your observations.   Thank you for noticing the “little” things we do to make your outpatient experience favorable.  Speedy recovery!  We will check on you soon!

resp.text: Thank you!  We appreciate your kind words and will share with our staff.  Have a super recovery!

name: Vincent Seabrook
text: First class service.  5 star rating.

name: William Wheat
text: Very nice service and friendly staff

resp.text: Thank you William.  I will share your kind remarks with our team.

name: Mark Patty (mwp1979)
text: Dr Stremmel is an excellent foot doctor. My wife and I have been to him many times. The staff is very knowledgeable and courteous.

name: Chelsea Cloud Brewton
text: Dr. Linde was awesome. He was quick and efficient and answered all my questions. I came in several times for follow up and he was patient and helpful each time. Highly recommend!

name: Marilyn Sills
text: Awesome doctors and staff. They always are able to work me in especially with my emergencies.  Thanks to these guys, especially Dr. Linde and Sheila Wilson! You guys are the best! Thanks.

name: Paige Hill
text: Great visit - Dr. Campbell took care of my needs - great instructions for care after the appointment - no pain experienced and toe healed great!  The nursing staff was wonderful too!  I highly recommend!

name: Virginia Storey
text: They are so organized you are in and out quickly. The staff is friendly and the doctors are knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this practice.  .

name: Dee Creel
text: Dr. David Linde and all of of the staff are wonderful!  They are very patient and kind.  My foot healed nicely and I needed very little pain medication.

name: Edith Cavallas
text: Every time I go for an appointment the staff is courteous. The wait is fast with no long wait times. Dr Linde is thorough and explains everything effectively. All my experiences have been great.

name: Greg Burden
text: Great staff and the doctor is very good.  He has exceptional bedside manner and very knowledgeable in his work.

name: AK Taufique
text: Dr. Linde is great as is the staff. 10/10 would recommend them to anyone.

name: Leonard Wertheimer
text: Very comfortable office to visit.  Doctors are very friendly and very good.

name: Sandra Carter
text: My experience was very satisfying.

name: SOL MESTER
text: Dr. Linde is a caring, excellent physician.  He listens, evaluates and actively resolves any reported problems. Has been my podiatrist for many years.  The staff are friendly and helpful in finding requested appointment dates and times. I very strongly recommend Dr. Linde to anyone needing foot care.

name: Alisa Poole
text: The staff and doctor were so kind and helpful! Best experience I’ve had!!

name: Meeka Acklin
text: This was my 2nd toe procedure & as usual it was a great experience. Dr. Campbell is nice & staff is awesome

name: Bob Yoe
text:
This as  great group
My feet are much better and it was easy to get in and out
I see why my cardiologist recommended them!

name: Mary Anna Raburn
text: Excellent experience! Feet used to hurt. I particularly had pain in my left foot after having a right knee replacement.  Other orthotics did not work and I developed plantar fasciitis.  Pain is gone and orthotics are comfortable.  Just follow the instructions they give you.

name: Stacy Rakestraw
text: Dr Linde and Dr Campbell are both great doctors. Their staff is so helpful and kind!

name: Becky Pfaff
text: Five stars is not enough!  Thank you from the bottom of my heart for such excellent care.  During this pandemic, it has been very difficult to get an appointment with a doctor as a new patient.  Dr. Campbell and his staff got me in right away and treated me like they had known me for years.  It goes so much further than this, I was in a life threatening situation and he went the extra mile to make sure I got the appropriate care.  For this, I will never be able to thank you enough.  Excellent and very professional staff.

name: Wakisha Hazzard
text: I went to Foot Specialists of Birmingham and they did an amazing job! The doctors are knowledgeable, the staff is friendly, and the office is clean. I will definitely be going back again. I had a great experience! 🙂

name: Judy Dunn
text: Could not ask for more or better treatment.

name: Pam Miller
text: I have been seeing Dr Linde for about 10 years. He is friendly, competent, thorough, and effective. He has successfully treated a couple of different issues for me and always has a plan of action. My teenager is also a patient for a sports foot issue and he also has treated my husband. I have never considered going to another foot specialist. I also like that he is a surgeon so he has a deeper idea of what the issues are and if surgery is needed he can handle that too. Highly recommended him. You won’t be disappointed.

name: Sheliah Janae
text: Had an amazing experience from the surgery up until my last appointment. I had no problems at all, Really made me feel like family! I would definitely recommend them..

name: Owen Kerley
text: Dr. Linde and the staff have restored my faith in doctors and their staff. They are conscientious, courteous and personable. I heartily recommend them.

name: Matthew Spivak
text: Dr. Linde and the Foot Specialist staff were incredibly friendly and professional throughout my entire visit. They took care of me in a timely manner and made sure all of my questions were answered before I left. I definitely encourage anyone suffering from foot pain to meet with Dr. Linde. He's straightforward, respectful, and transparent, and he goes the extra mile to ensure you're well cared for.

name: Catherine D
text: I had a wonderful experience here. The staff was so kind and helpful and the doctor was knowledgeable, kind, and patient! Great place all around!

name: Ala Bubba
text: I have been a patient

name: Donna Hogan
text: Dr. Linde and the staff were all well informed, friendly and courteous, and spent time explaining procedures and options to me patiently and kindly. I had a painful hammertoe that required correction - I was truly not concerned with aesthetics, just wanted to not be in pain! Dr. Linde managed to correct the toe so I have no more pain, plus my toe looks good! Thank you!

name: Donna Loebler
text: Posting this review for my mother who saw Dr. Linde today. I highly recommend Dr Linde because of his kindness and gentleness during my procedure. He is very kind, gentle and patient.

name: Gaye Cooper
text: My visit was awesome.  Dr Linde is a very good doctor and I have been going  to him for years. He is concerned, considerick,good bed side manner. I could go on and on but  just know if you choose him for your doctor you will not go wrong.

name: Heidi Johnston
text: Courteous, knowledgeable and efficient. That’s Dr. Linde’s practice and office. Been going there years and wouldn’t see anyone else.

name: Ty Dodson
text: I have been to 3 different podiatrists in this area . This was by far the most thorough exam that I have had.  I would highly recommend them.

name: Elizabeth Sevilla
text: Dr. Linde is always very professional, knowledgeable and polite. The staff is also courteous. What a blessing!!!!

name: Ellen Maple
text: Dr Campbell is great! I have used him for plantar fasciitis and 2 of my 4 kids have seen him as well. Great for the entire family!

name: Elois Byrd
text: I appreciate the care and attention that was shown to me by Dr. Linde, Ms. Shelia, and other staff during my surgery and office visits. Everyone was very knowledgeable and supportive, thanks so much.

name: Brenda Reid
text: Dr. Linde and his staff are all very friendly and professional.  Dr. Linde spends time with you, explains your problem and the necessary treatment plan.  He gives you time to ask questions and gives you detailed answers.  I never felt rushed.

name: James Moore
text: It is always a pleasure to visit these fine folks I always come out feeling better than when I went in

name: Steve Rambin
text: Easy to make appointments and Dr. Linde and as staff are terrific

name: warren seiler
text: Absolutely great experience from start to finish!  Karen was great on the phone in setting up my appointment and answering all of my questions.  Check in was easy, and staff was great (Anethia and Kristina).  I came mainly to get a new pair of orthotics but wanted to see Dr. Campbell.  He was great, very thorough and I know his treatment plan will help me.  I am a local physician and am happy to know the group to refer patients!  Thanks so much for a great experience!

name: Love Knox
text: If I could give 0 I would. This Doctor will short change his employees. Worked for him and never received a paycheck. He want return at phone calls or anything.

name: Robert Bentley Motors Inc.
text: GREAT DOCTOR

name: Devyn Lamon
text: I called to ask a few questions about an injury I have and the woman who answered the phone was extremely rude and sarcastic with me. I will not be making an appointment here.
